recommended_treatment: The main treatment plan includes switching from Allegra to Zyrtec or loratadine for allergic rhinitis. Samples of Nasonex nasal spray were given for three weeks.

Operative fixation for right Achilles tendon rupture. Nonweightbearing in a splint for 10 days, nonweightbearing in a dynamic brace for 4 weeks, then a walking boot for another six weeks with a lift. Lovenox for a week after surgery, followed by aspirin. High tide boot at six weeks and a 1" lift. Weight-bearing until surgery scheduled this week.
icd_10_description: ICD-10 code S86.011A is for a partial traumatic rupture of right Achilles tendon, initial encounter

recommended_treatment: Laparoscopic antecolic antegastric Roux-en-Y gastric bypass with EEA anastomosis
icd_10_description: Morbid (severe) obesity due to excess calories

recommended_treatment: Neck exploration; tracheostomy; removal of foreign body, tracheal metallic stent material; dilation distal trachea; placement of #8 Shiley single cannula tracheostomy tube
primary_diagnosis: Airway obstruction secondary to severe subglottic tracheal stenosis with foreign body in the trachea
icd_10_description: Other specified diseases of upper respiratory tract

recommended_treatment: The main treatment plan includes self-catheterization in the event of urinary retention, follow-up with the urology clinic at MCG in 6 weeks, prescription for 6 months of Flomax and Proscar, and scheduling a PSA level test before the follow-up visit.
primary_diagnosis: Benign prostatic hypertrophy (BPH) with recurrent urinary retention post kidney transplant
